description:
General Description

Working under the direction of the co-owner, this position is responsible for distributor attachment sales and development, coordinating and reviewing marketing plans, forecasting attachment build quantities, helping in the development of new attachments, assisting in the development and review of product documents, and supporting the customer service/sales department in day-to-day tasks. Responsible for the supervision of the Graphic Design/Marketing personnel.

Education, Certifications, Licenses, and/or Registrations

High school diploma or equivalent is required. Associate degree or higher is preferred. Valid driver license is required.

Experience

Minimum one (1) year of sales experience is required.

Specialized Knowledge and Skills
• Knowledge of the agricultural equipment distributor and dealer sales process is preferred.
• Strong leadership and communication skills with the ability to organize and prioritize a workload determined by the senior management team.
• Computer proficient with a working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite products.
• Working knowledge of office equipment including phones, computers, copiers, etc.
• Must have strong verbal, written, oral, and interpersonal skills.
• Must have clear communication skills and be able to reiterate information as necessary.
• Able to follow instructions and retain information.
• Time management skills
• Collaboration skills
• Confidentiality
• Able to work independently.
• Attention to detail.
• Able to multitask.
• Flexible in work and schedule.
• Problem solving skills.

Essential Duties

1. Manage Distributor network including contracts, expectations, goals, and development.
• Maintain the internal Distributor requirements document and evaluate Distributors accordingly.
• Monitor and review Distributor actual performance versus expected performance, taking or proposing actions as necessary.
• Consistently communicate with territory managers regarding goals, comparisons in sales, timelines, and overall upkeep of working relationships.
• Develop and implement Distributor sales program(s).

2. Manage attachment sales orders.
• Communicate with customers and monitor future large volume orders.
• Coordinate and communicate orders with customers, production department, and shipping department.
• Communicate current order status with customers.
• Review and update notes on open customer orders.

3. Establish and maintain production forecast of large moving serial number units.

4. Update attachment production sheet for production meetings.

5. Monitor attachment lead times and communicate those lead times to customers.

6. Report on the status of attachment sales to management.

7. Participate in New Product Idea Analysis.
• Perform Competitor Assessment portion of New Product Idea Analysis.
• Offer input on Product Life and Sales Potential.

8. Offer input on Design Requirements for attachment products.

9. Coordinate attachment field testing and identify participants.

10. Oversee the control, development, and updating of Product Documents.

11. Coordinate sales activities related to new attachments, attachment revisions, and obsoleting of attachments.

12. Oversee attachment product branding.

13. Ensure prudent use of marketing budget and provide comparative report of budgeted marketing expenses to actual expenses to management.

14. Establish standardized attachment training materials, including documented scripts, to be used for Danuser customer service employee training.

15. Train customer service employees on attachment products. Comprehensive training shall cover all areas from initial customer inquiry through technical and service-related topics after the sale.

16. Supervise Graphic Design and Marketing personnel.
• Oversee workload, special projects, timelines, etc.
• Collaborate on video and photo shoots.
• Approve/deny time-off requests.

17. Follow all company and safety policies, guidelines, and rules.

18. Follow all quality standards.

19. Work in a fast-paced environment.

20. Stay focused and on task with minimal supervision.

21. Maintain a clean and organized work area.

22. Maintain regular and reliable attendance.

23. Perform other duties as assigned.

Work Environment

Mainly an office environment position, this role routinely uses standard office equipment, such as computers, phones, photocopiers/printers, and filing cabinets. Intermittent trips to the manufacturing shop floor will be necessary. Safety eyewear and other PPE will be required as needed.

Physical Demands

Must be able to concentrate for extended periods of time. The position may require long periods of sitting or standing while using office equipment. Bending, reaching, and lifting may be required for product testing, photo/video shoots, and trade show set-ups and teardowns.

Schedule

Full time. Regular office hours Monday through Friday, 7:30 AM – 4:30 PM.

Travel

Attend trade shows, conventions, and distributor meetings.
